text:
Confidence interval estimates result in a range of values within which the actual value
of a parameter will lie, given the probability of 1-a. Here, alpha, a, is called the level
of significance for the confidence interval, and the probability 1-a is referred to as
the degree of confidence. For example, we might estimate that the population mean of
random variables will range from 15 to 25 with a 95% degree of confidence, or at the
5% level of significance.
